data.title: Fixes for the Window Size on Windows (and linux?)
data.body:
Added code to correctly report the DisplayMode rather than default to 800x600
Added code to correlty report the supported resolutions on windows/linux, note we only report 32 bit modes at this time.
Reworked the setting of the display so that when you switch from fullscreen to windowed the normal use displaymode is restored

data.title: iOS and MacOS builds broken when compiling under 2.11.2
data.body:
https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/develop/MonoGame.Framework/MacOS/Graphics/Texture2D.cs#L729
https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/develop/MonoGame.Framework/iOS/Graphics/Texture2D.cs#L618

'bitmap' is used without guaranteed initialization in both cases. This code seems like it should never have worked, but appears to work in 2.10.9. I'd submit a pull request to fix it for 2.11.2, but I have no idea what the developer was trying to do here so I'd rather hold off.

Looks like it came in with commit 8e59a138.

-Ed

data.title: When SwapChainBackgroundPanel has no children game crashes on resume
data.body:
Repro steps:
1. Create a new Metro C# project in Visual Studio
2. Add references to the latest MonoGame project
3. Instantiate a new SharedGraphicsDeviceManager in App.xaml.cs
4. Make MainPage.xaml extends from SwapChainBackgroundPanel
5. Add an OnLoad handler to MainPage and have it apply changes to the SharedGraphicsDeviceManager
6. Launch the game without debugging (not from Visual Studio)
7. Switch to another app for a minute or two
8. Switch back to the game

Expected:
The game resumes and runs normally.

Observed:
The game times out and then crashes.

See the following project for an example: http://anotherearlymorning.com/files/MonoGameCrashOnResume.zip

data.title: Android Calling Initialize / LoadContent twice?
data.body:
On Develop3d.

This was reported against the PSS branch by xesf here: http://monogame.codeplex.com/discussions/355544  (Search BeforeUpdate)

This code was taken from the Android branch, where it still appears to be. Could someone with the android bits set up please test if Initialize/LoadContent are being called twice and fix it up if so.

My fix for PSS is here, Android should be the same:
https://github.com/danzel/MonoGame/commit/051557938093d75ffd384ec5955abf1d211b2b9f

data.title: Spritefonts not rendered in Windows 8 Metro
data.body: I'm currently porting a 2D XNA game for Windows 8 Metro with MonoGame. Everything looks fine, except one thing : the texts are not rendered. I took a brief look at the spritefont implementation but I couldn't fix the bug, although I think there might be a problem with how the spritefonts are loaded. If I'm not mistaken, the spritefont's texture is completely transparent.

data.title: Use Tao.SDL for playing Songs on Linux
data.body:
Hey there,
Since I diddn't get a response on the Codeplex site but need it anyway, I implemented ogg/vorbis and mp3 sound support for the Linux MediaPlayer.
It is a simple reimplementation of the Song class to use Tao.SDL for playing sound.
It also includes a few lines of initialization in OpenTKGamePlatform (but that #if'd to be only used on Linux).
It also implements the MediaStateChanged event that should be provided by the MediaPlayer class (this will work on Linux. On other platforms, only user-invoked state-changes are reported, such as when the Stop() method is called. A MediaStateCahnged event because a song has finished will only be invoked on Linux).
If you prefere to not be dependant on Tao.SDL that much, feel free to reject this pull request. I'm going to use it anyway :p

Note: this does break old code in rare circumstances. SDL can only do resampling if the sampling-rate is a multiple of 11,025 Hz. So if there are files played that are e.g. 48,000 Hz, sound may be distorted. Most common sampling rates work good, however.

Note2: This code should not only support ogg and mp3, but all formats that are supported by SDL Mixer.

data.title: Maximize/Unmaximize and fullscreen fixes
data.body:
This fixes the Issue for OpenTK game windows (at least on linux), that fullscreen-mode can't be toggled during runtime. It also fixes issues with the maximize-button that is provided when .AllowUserResizing is set.
It might not cover all corner cases, but I couldn't observe any other issues with this fix (while there were a lot of issues before).
Issues might still occure if: The programmer sets the window state to maximized from the code (is this even possible in MonoGame?) or if the user sets the window to fullscreen with his window-manager (I'm pretty sure there is no way to do that, so this is a non-issue)

data.title: MG3D: NPE in GraphicsDevice.Initialize on Android
data.body:
GraphicsDevice.Initialize()
# if OPENGL
# if GLES

```
        string[] extstring = GL.GetString(RenderbufferStorage.Extensions).Split(' ');                       
```
# else

```
        string[] extstring = GL.GetString(StringName.Extensions).Split(' ');    
```
# endif

This code should be:
# if OPENGL
# if GLES

```
        string caps = GL.GetString(RenderbufferStorage.Extensions);
        if(caps != null) {
            extstring = caps.Split(' ');                        
        }
```
# else

```
        string caps = GL.GetString(StringName.Extensions);
        if(caps != null) {
            extstring = caps.Split(' ');    
        }
```
# endif

On an Android device using MonoAndroid (latest as of 7/6/12) the result of GetString(..) can be NULL.

data.title: develop branch: Android - lock default orientation based on PreferredBackBuffer(Width/Height)
data.body:
GraphicsDeviceManager:
- Set default preferred size to a landscape aspect ratio to cause it to default to landscape if the user does not set the preferred sizes
- Removed calls to ResetClientBounds in setters for PreferredBackBuffer(Width/Height). Setting preferred buffer sizes should not have immediate effect. They are just stored for next device reset.

AndroidGameWindow:
- Use PreferredBackBuffer(Width/Height) to determine landscape vs portrait when handling SupportedOrientations == DisplayOrientation.Default.

Also rolling back a previous change which pointed the ThirdPary/Libs folder to an old pre-SharpDX revision.

data.title: Game not calling OnExiting()
SpriteBatch with a source/dest rect works different then Windows
data.body:
I'm reporting this as an issue, because I'm almost certain there's a problem with SpriteBatch when a source / destination rect are used with a origin.
I have an object that I want to rotate around it's center. The destination is 5 times the size of the source. What is happening is that when the destination rect is different then the source, the rotation origin changes and the object doesn't rotate around it's center anymore.
I'm almost certain there's a problem, because I've inspect the inputs for the SpriteBatch.Draw call on both Windows and Mac, and the values are exactly the same.
In windows the object rotates nicely in the center, on Mac, the objects rotates like the earth around the sun.

Here's the method with the issue:

public void Draw (Texture2D texture,
            Rectangle destinationRectangle,
            Nullable<Rectangle> sourceRectangle,
            Color color,
            float rotation,
            Vector2 origin,
            SpriteEffects effect,
            float depth)

Strange is that after inspecting this method I don't know how the Windows version works! It shoudn't I guess.
I have a fix for Mac, all I have to do is to multiply the origin by the scale before the call to SpriteBatch.

data.title: develop3d branch - Android orientaton handling
data.body:
- OrientationListener moved to it's own file which helps with debugging in VS. It has better checks to avoid forcing orientation changes unless the closest orientation is actually supported.
- Handled DisplayOrientation.Default as WP7 does, ie LandscapeLeft | LandscapeRight.
- Handled LandscapeRight correctly for devices with OS >= 2.3. Prior to this there was no way to request the orientation to change as the ScreenOrientation enum values only and Portrait and Landscape. 
- Removed incorrect flipping of touch positions for LandscapeRight

I believe that this PR resolves issue https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/issues/537

data.title: develop branch: Android orientation handling
data.body:
- OrientationListener moved to it's own file which helps with debugging in VS. It has better checks to avoid forcing orientation changes unless the closest orientation is actually supported.
- Handled DisplayOrientation.Default as WP7 does, ie LandscapeLeft | LandscapeRight.
- Handled LandscapeRight correctly for devices with OS >= 2.3. Prior to this there was no way to request the orientation to change as the ScreenOrientation enum values only and Portrait and Landscape. 
- Removed incorrect flipping of touch positions for LandscapeRight

I believe that this PR resolves issue: https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/issues/498
